reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Super friendly staff. Great balcony room - we couldn't stop going out on it to see the stunning and magical views. Easy walk to the ferry (12 Euros each for an all day pass). Visited Bellaggio and Varenna. Highly recommend both. The ferry runs every half hour so it's simple to follow and shouldn't be missed. The whole hotel is beautiful - even the halls have hand painted floral designs, thick carpeting and shiny shoe polishers, The rooms are all super upgraded, very comfortable and quiet. Lots of built in closets, a safe and a refrigerator. The restaurant is absolutely lovely, with great lake views, terrific polished wait staff and wonderful food. The buffet breakfast included fresh hot bread and rolls, brie, salami choices, fresh fruit, home made jams, croissants and danishes, hard boiled eggs, pears and peaches in juice, and more. You will definitely be very impressed. We made little sandwiches for the road and they worked out well. The fresh coffee (or Capuccino) was good and served in nice china cups and saucers.
reviews.title: Great in Every Way !!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a small parking lot which worked out perfectly since it was off-season and not a problem getting spots. Even if you do not get a spot, there is plenty of parking close by, so it would not be a problem.The gas station across the street had a small grocery store inside where we purchased soda, water and snacks. This was a nice surprise as it is sometimes not easy to find these items on he road.
reviews.title: A little disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Make sure your camera battery is fully charged. This is a stunning area and you will be taking a lot of pictures. Be sure to visit the old church in Bellaggio - it's all the way to the left when you get off the ferry and up the road from the big hotel. It's from 1560 and has a great feel to it.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay, Fantastic Hotel with Spectacular Views.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The manager opened up the buffet early just for us as we had an early flight. Now that's going above and beyond. I can't tell you how much we appreciated that.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a long way up the lake, but believe me, this hotel is worth the drive. Have a great time.
reviews.title: Stunning Lake View Hotel - Don't stay anywhere Else!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011
reviews.text: Quite honestly, we struggled a bit with this location, but we're pleasantly surprised to like it much more than that which we visited. From the time we arrived until the day we left, we enjoyed a spotless, comfortable room that we hated to leave. Hotel staff members were cordial, gracious, and helpful. We would definitely like to stay here again.
reviews.title: All that we hoped it would be...and more.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011
reviews.text: This hotel has it all, the staff are extremely helpful and friendly, gorgeous views of the lake and lovely on site restaurant you couldn't ask for more. After 7 weeks of travel this was the finest hotel, it beats the four and five stars we stayed in. My partner was extremely happy and he is very hard to please.
reviews.title: Can not believe it is only 3 stars!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The location of the hotel in Tremezzo is perfect. Only steps away from the Tremezzo ferry pier and the bus from Como San Giovanni train station stops right outside the hotel.
reviews.title: Great views of Lake Como!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tremezzo is a great place to stay during your trip to Lake Como region as it's not too busy and over crowded like Bellagio and relatively close by to all the other points of interests along Lake Como. But just a word of warning, as Tremezzo is approx 40mins by ferry/1hr by bus to Como and the ferries and buses are not extremely frequent and the last service (from Como to Tremezzo) departs at approx 7pm, it would be time consuming to make a day trip down to Milan. This maybe a factor to consider if you encounter a rainy day at Lake Como and sightseeing at such picturesque locations may not be as enjoyable. You might be tempted to pop into Milan for some retail therapy/cultural sightseeing/Michelin star cuisine but the logistics makes such a day trip not as worthwhile (it would take a lot of time to get to Milan and you wouldn't get to spend much time there before having to head back to Tremezzo).
reviews.title: Wonderful finale to our trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the "side room with lake/road view and balcony" which was a decent sized room and the bathroom was surprising spacious. The small balcony offered views of both the lake the main road, so it can be a little bit noisy if you leave the windows opened. The room was clean and comfortable but a little dark at night (lamps dotted around the room but none of them are too bright). The bathroom window actually opens up to the balcony of the room next to ours so your neighbours can pop their head into your bathroom if you leave the window open.
reviews.title: Nice but not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having travelled the world we have never felt compelled to write a review on Trip Advisor until now! From the last minute panic on our part as to whether we were actually going to travel to Tremezzo due to a problem with our driving licences to the end of our holiday the owners and staff of this fabulous hotel could not have been more helpful. The owners and staff were both friendly, helpful and knowledgeable, the restaurant (both breakfast, lunch and dinner) provided first class food and service which would have not been out of place in a Mitchelin Star restaurant. How can anyone criticise the rooms? They were delightful, even the attic rooms with less of a lake view, as we found out when we unexpectedly returned to the hotel for the last night of our holiday. It goes without saying that we have already booked to return next year.
reviews.title: 5* Star hotel in disguise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all I must say that I personally didn't stay at this hotel - but booked it as a surprise anniversary trip for my parents.
reviews.title: Superb service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I dealt with Maria who was excellent - friendly, quick to respond to e-mails, patient and extremely efficient. Booking was easy and she helped with any queries I had e.g. booking day trips and storing luggage in the event of an early arrival.
reviews.title: a brilliant experience.!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My parents reported that they absolutely loved this hotel and would love to stay again. From my own perspective, my whole experience was positive. I was 100% sure just from those few e-mails with Maria (and other reviews here on TA) that my parents would have a lovely stay.
reviews.title: Wonderful place, great views, best food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is easy to reach by bus or ferry but my parents did note that they had to wait until the fourth C10 bus from San Giovanni station before they could board so if you are tired or in a hurry, it may be worth paying for the hotel pick up or take a taxi/walk to como le nord as the bus station and start of C10 route is there.
reviews.title: The best place to sat in Lake Como

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel sits right on the lake--not across the road from the lake. The views are astounding from the rooms (assuming you pay for a lake view room). The rooms are large by European standards with excellent bathrooms. Bed very comfortable. Desk and chairs in room. Good TV with English news programs, which was important for us.
reviews.title: WOW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast--amazing with all kinds of breads and condiments. Plus all kinds of meats, cheese, and eggs. Great coffees and tea. Etc.
reviews.title: A stunning hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dinner at restaurant--just superb with great meat and fish selections. Some of the best meals ever, with special kudos to the filet mignon.
reviews.title: We just keep coming back for more!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010
reviews.text: Service--Tiziano and Ezio could never do enough for you. They work at least 12 hours per day each, serving you both breakfast and dinner. They provide any info you need for your visit with enthusiasm. Broken handle on shower fixed within a couple of hours. Safe won't open--Tiziano bounds up the stairs and opens it immediately. In general, I have never experienced this high a level of service and friendliness any where despite many years of travel.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, stunning location, fabulous.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.title: Lives up to the reputation!
